questions.name: Booklet 1 (1)
questions.text: Use the periodic table to fill in the following information on chlorine
questions.solution: <img=files/chem20/periodic-table/front.png> <br=1>The element name, IUPAC symbol <i=(aka symbol)> and atomic number can be determined by looking at the top right guide and then the elements square. <br=2> The group number can be found by which column it is in (1-18) found at the top. <br=2>The type is found by whether it is to the left of the staircase or not <list=dot=right: non-metal=left: metal><br=2>The state at SATP is found by the boxes color<list=ul=white: Solid=black: Liquid=gray: Gas><br=2>Finally the family is determined by the group (column) of the element:<br=1><img=./files/chem20/periodic-table/families.png>
